Articles.Content:
A very nice chap over at [UnmannedSpaceflight.com](http://www.unmannedspaceflight.com/index.php?showtopic=8003&st=0) released a compilation of all the Voyager pics at Jupiter and at Saturn on Youtube. Looked very Kerbal to me, so thought you might be interested.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bf5QJ8iFxUs?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/nJBedpsJUKU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Fascinating. I never knew they had to keep making so many PYR adjustments.
It's a shame he didn't correct the camera positioning. It's a bit too jumpy to be watchable.
Yes a stabilized one would be amazing.
Cool images, but a bit to epilepsy for my taste.
